perturbation.original_text: V. Review of development plan (containing soil and water conservation plan and environmental impact assessment report) (about 4 - 6 months);
perturbation.changed_text: V. Review of development plan (containing soil and water conservation plan and environmental impact assessment report) (about 1 month);
perturbation.explanation: The original text provides a review period of 4-6 months for the development plan, including soil and water conservation and environmental impact assessment reports. Reducing this review period to 1 month may not comply with Taiwanese environmental regulations that mandate sufficient review time for such comprehensive plans. Insufficient time may lead to inadequate assessment and potential environmental damage.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Potentially violates Taiwan's Environmental Impact Assessment Act and related regulations, which require sufficient time for proper review of environmental impact assessments and related plans.

perturbation.original_text: VII. Change of usage zoning and category of the land (about 2 - 4 months);
perturbation.changed_text: VII. Change of usage zoning and category of the land (about 1 week);
perturbation.explanation: The original text allots 2-4 months for changing the land usage zoning and category. Reducing this to one week is insufficient to meet procedural requirements under Taiwanese Land Use Planning Act which mandates a public hearing, review by multiple agencies, and potential appeals which will naturally take more than a week.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Taiwanese Land Use Planning Act, specifically the process for changing land usage which involves administrative review and public comment periods.

perturbation.original_text: IX. Application for construction license (including review on green construction materials and barrier-free facilities) (about 1.0 month)
perturbation.changed_text: IX. Application for construction license (including review on green construction materials and barrier-free facilities) (about 3 days)
perturbation.explanation: The original text allocates approximately one month for the application and review of a construction license. Reducing this period to three days fails to realistically accommodate the necessary due diligence and approval processes which include review of documents for compliance with green construction standards and barrier free access. This does not adhere to Taiwanese Building Act.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Taiwanese Building Act, which outlines the procedures and requirements for construction license applications and reviews.
